News.Title: Transrail Lighting Q3 FY26 Results Show Strong Growth
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting reported impressive Q3 FY26 performance with 32% revenue growth to Rs. 1,796 crores and 49% nine-month growth to Rs. 5,017 crores, driven by strong T&D execution.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Q3FY26 Results & Board Changes
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting reports Q3FY26 revenue of ₹1,776.68 crores, up 32.56% YoY. Net profit rises to ₹111.90 crores from ₹97.57 crores. Board appoints new independent director.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures ₹527 Crore Orders
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited announces winning new orders worth ₹5.27 billion, marking a significant business development for the infrastructure company.

News.Title: Transrail expands globally with ₹527-cr orders
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting secures ₹527 crore in new orders across MENA and India, bringing FY26 cumulative inflows to ₹5,637 crore with strong L1 pipeline of ₹2,800 crore.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures ₹822 Crore New Orders Including Major GCC Transmission Project
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited secured new orders worth ₹822 crore, including a major turnkey EPC contract for 400kV transmission line in GCC region and additional wins in Civil and Poles Lighting businesses. The company's cumulative order inflows for FY26 have risen to more than ₹5,110 crore, with an additional L1 position of over ₹2,000 crore strengthening its order book and business growth visibility.

News.Title: NCLT Mumbai Dismisses Goodrich Logistics' Legal Petition Against Transrail Lighting
News.Summary: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) in Mumbai has rejected a petition filed by Goodrich Logistics against Transrail Lighting. The dismissal resolves the legal dispute in favor of Transrail Lighting, though specific details of the petition's nature were not disclosed.

News.Title: Transrail Raises Revenue Growth Guidance to 27%
News.Summary: Transrail has increased its revenue growth guidance from 22% to 27%, indicating stronger expected performance. The upward revision suggests improved business prospects and could positively impact investor confidence in the company's growth trajectory.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures ₹548 Crore New Orders Including International MENA Project
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has secured new orders worth ₹548 crore, including an international transmission line project in the MENA region, bringing total FY26 orders above ₹4,285 crore. The company has also achieved L1 status for additional orders worth ₹2,575 crore, indicating strong business momentum and international expansion.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports Strong Q2 & H1 FY26 Results with 61% Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting achieved revenue growth of 61% year-on-year for H1 FY26 at INR 3,221 crore, with EBITDA growing 49% to INR 386 crore and PAT surging 84% to INR 197 crore. The company secured new orders worth INR 3,740 crore in H1 including entry into three new countries, maintaining an unexecuted order book of INR 17,799 crore with 25% revenue growth guidance for the full year.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Targets Double-Digit Margins in FY26, CEO Expects to Beat 25% Revenue Growth Target
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting expects strong revenue growth and double-digit EBITDA margins in FY26. CEO Randeep Narang stated the company is on track to surpass its 25% revenue growth target in FY26, with current guidance of 11.5% to 12% EBITDA margins and 23% to 25% plus revenue growth. The company projects 20% to 25% revenue growth for next year, with H2 typically performing stronger than H1. Net debt increased to Rs 703 crore from Rs 613 crore in the previous quarter due to capex for brownfield expansions and a greenfield plant. Narang indicated that 80% of expenditure has been completed and expects only marginal debt increases going forward. The company's international focus remains on Africa, Southeast Asia and SAARC regions, with minimal US exposure limiting impact from potential US tariffs. Narang clarified confusion regarding World Bank's ineligible firms list, stating it referenced TARIL (Transformers and Rectifiers), not TLL (Transrail Lighting).

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports No Deviation in IPO Fund Utilization for Quarter Ended September 2025
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited submitted its monitoring agency report for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, prepared by CARE Ratings Limited. The report shows no deviation from the stated objectives of the Rs. 450 crore IPO and private placement issue. The company utilized Rs. 22.59 crore for working capital requirements and Rs. 4.72 crore for capital expenditure during the quarter. Total funds utilized reached Rs. 331.36 crore, leaving Rs. 97.64 crore unutilized. The company has not used any funds for General Corporate Purpose during this quarter. However, there are ongoing delays in implementation of objects from the timeline mentioned in the offer document, where funds for all objects were to be utilized by FY25. The unutilized proceeds are deployed in fixed deposits with various banks including ICICI Bank and FAB Bank.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports Strong Q2 Growth, Targets ₹10,000Cr Order Book by FY27
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting reported quarterly revenue of ₹912 crores, marking 14% year-over-year growth, with profit after tax reaching ₹64 crores, up 18% year-over-year. The company currently holds an order book worth ₹7,000 crores, representing 25% year-over-year growth. The company is expanding its EPC projects across transmission, rail electrification, and smart infrastructure sectors. Management announced plans for ₹400 crores in capital expenditure for tower manufacturing capabilities. The company has set ambitious targets to achieve a ₹10,000 crores order book by FY27 while focusing on improved cash flow efficiency.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports 90.37 Crore Profit, Approves 32% Stake Investment in CEDEC Engineering
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited reported a standalone profit of 90.37 crores for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared to 108.75 crores in the same period last year. Revenue from operations stood at 1,537.91 crores versus 1,632.56 crores in the previous year. The Board approved investment of up to 37 lakhs for a 32% equity stake in CEDEC Engineering Private Limited, which will be used as a vehicle to acquire Bridge Hydro business from Gammon Engineering. The company also noted the resignation of Mrs. Vita Dani as Non-Executive Non-Independent Director (nominee of Asiana Fund I) effective November 10, 2025, due to withdrawal of nomination by the fund. Basic earnings per share for the quarter was 6.73 rupees compared to 8.10 rupees in the previous year.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports 65% Jump in Q2 Net Profit, Plans 32% Investment in Cedec Engineering
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting reported consolidated net profit of 910 million rupees for Q2, up from 551 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue increased to 15.34 billion rupees from 10.68 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA rose to 1.84 billion rupees from 1.38 billion rupees, though EBITDA margin declined to 11.98% from 12.95%. The company plans to invest 32% in Cedec Engineering.

News.Title: Transindia Real Estate Reports Mixed Q2 Results with Higher Profit but Lower EBITDA
News.Summary: Transindia Real Estate reported quarterly consolidated net profit of 88 million rupees compared to 66 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue remained relatively flat at 201.4 million rupees versus 200.2 million rupees year-over-year. However, EBITDA declined to 87.9 million rupees from 122.6 million rupees, while EBITDA margin compressed to 43.64% from 61.24% in the previous year.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Clarifies No Connection to World Bank's Ineligible Firms List
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited issued a clarification stating that neither the company nor its subsidiaries have been included in the World Bank's list of ineligible firms and individuals. The company emphasized it has no relation to the entity YTARIL/TRIL that appears on the World Bank's list. Transrail Lighting expressed concern that references linking the company to the World Bank's ineligible list could create unnecessary disruption to its ongoing business operations. The company confirmed its commitment to maintaining compliance with SEBI listing obligations and disclosure requirements.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Schedules Earnings Call for Q2 and H1 Results
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited has scheduled an earnings call for Wednesday, November 12, 2025, at 3:30 PM IST to discuss its un-audited financial results for the quarter and half-year ended September 30, 2025. The call will be led by Managing Director Randeep Narang and Chief Financial Officer Deepak Khandelwal. Phillip Capital India Private Limited is hosting the conference call to discuss the company's operational and financial performance. The company trades on BSE with scrip code 544317 and on NSE with symbol TRANSRAIL.

News.Title: Asiana Fund I Sells 2.012% Stake in Transrail Lighting Limited
News.Summary: Asiana Fund I sold 27,01,555 equity shares in Transrail Lighting Limited, representing 2.012% of the company's voting share capital. The sale occurred through open market transactions between June 10, 2025 and September 16, 2025. Prior to this sale, Asiana Fund I held 72,41,617 shares (5.394% stake), and after the transaction, their holding reduced to 45,40,062 shares (3.382% stake). The fund is not part of Transrail Lighting's promoter group. Transrail Lighting has a total equity share capital of 1,34,256,025 shares with a face value of INR 2 each, and is listed on both NSE and BSE.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures ₹421 Crore Orders Including Large Africa Transmission Project
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited secured new orders worth ₹421 crore, including a large transmission line contract in a new African country. The company's order inflows for FY26 have exceeded ₹3,500 crore as of August 2025, representing a 78% year-on-year growth. The new orders span international transmission and distribution projects as well as poles and lighting segments. MD & CEO Randeep Narang highlighted the expansion into a new African country and emphasized the company's diversified capabilities and growing global presence. Transrail operates across 60 countries with over 2,300 employees, providing turnkey EPC solutions in power transmission and distribution, civil construction, railways, and solar projects.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Targets ₹9,500-10,000 Crore Order Inflows for FY26
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting expects order inflows of ₹9,500-10,000 crore by year end, matching previous year levels. The Mumbai-based EPC company has secured ₹3,100 crore in orders year-to-date, representing 57% growth over last year. The order book maintains a 55% domestic and 45% international split. The company is confident of achieving 22-25% revenue growth guidance, with quarterly results showing ₹1,650 crore revenue. Transrail recently secured two new orders worth ₹837 crore, bringing total order inflows beyond ₹3,157 crore. The company is reducing Bangladesh exposure to 5-6% by year end and has committed over ₹500 crore for capacity expansion projects expected by March 2026. Transrail Lighting has a market capitalization of ₹10,411.55 crore with shares gaining over 39% in the last year.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures ₹837 Crore in New Orders, FY26 Total Reaches ₹3,157 Crore
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has secured new orders worth ₹837 crore. The company's cumulative orders for FY26 have surpassed ₹3,157 crore, representing a 57% year-on-year increase in orders.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures Fresh Orders Worth ₹701 Crore
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has secured fresh orders valued at ₹701 crore.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports 81% Revenue Growth in Q1 with Strong Order Book of Rs 15,637 Crores
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting delivered robust quarterly results with revenue growing 81% year-on-year to Rs 1,660 crores and profit after tax more than doubling with 105% growth to Rs 106 crores. EBITDA margins stood at 12.03% for the quarter. The company secured new orders worth Rs 1,748 crores, representing 72% higher intake compared to the previous year's first quarter. The unexecuted order book including L1 stands at Rs 15,637 crores, with 93% in the T&D segment split equally between domestic and international projects. Crisil upgraded the company's credit rating to AA- with stable outlook for long-term from A+ previously, while short-term rating was upgraded to A1+ from A1. The company is progressing with Phase-I CAPEX of Rs 327 crores for capacity expansion, with brownfield expansion of tower factory almost completed and greenfield project on track for commissioning by January 2026. Management maintains revenue growth guidance of 22-25% and EBITDA margin guidance of 11.5-12%. The company completed large projects including two 765 KV projects, three 400 KV lines, and one project in Africa during the quarter.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Shares Hit Record High as Net Profit Doubles in First Quarter
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Ltd. shares reached a record high of Rs 825 after reporting strong quarterly results. The company's consolidated net profit doubled to Rs 106 crore from Rs 51.7 crore, while revenue increased 82.49% to Rs 1,637 crore from Rs 897 crore. EBITDA grew 66% to Rs 200 crore from Rs 120 crore. Growth was driven by the transmission and distribution segment and higher profit sharing from joint ventures. However, EBITDA margin declined 100 basis points to 12% from 13%. The stock gained 3.28% to the record high and was trading 2.37% higher at Rs 813.3. The stock has advanced 46.36% over 12 months and 50.09% year-to-date. Trading volume was 4.4 times the 30-day average. Two analysts maintain 'buy' ratings with an average price target implying 11.4% upside.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Targets 12% Ebitda Margin and 20-25% Revenue Growth in FY26
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting is targeting an Ebitda margin of 12% in FY26, driven by strong performance in its transmission and distribution (T&D) business. Managing Director and CEO Randeep Narang stated the company aims for 20-25% revenue growth in FY26, having achieved Rs 1,650 crore in quarterly results. The company is targeting an order book of Rs 9,000-10,000 crore, focusing on projects with healthy margin profiles rather than volume. Transrail has bid for Rs 8,000 crore worth of fresh tenders, with another Rs 25,000 crore in the pipeline over the next 3-4 months. The company sees potential opportunities worth Rs 1 lakh crore in domestic and international markets combined, aiming for 10-12% market share. Revenue is evenly split between domestic and international markets, while the order book favors domestic projects at a 60:40 ratio. T&D business accounts for 92% of revenues and 90-92% of the order book. Shares closed 13.78% higher at Rs 803 on Wednesday.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Shares Jump 13% on Strong Q1 Results and Order Growth
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting shares surged 13.2% to Rs 800, recording their biggest single-day gain since listing. The engineering firm reported a 105% year-on-year increase in consolidated net profit to Rs 106 crore for the June quarter, while revenue from operations rose 81% to Rs 1,660 crore from Rs 916 crore. The growth was driven by strong performance in the Transmission & Distribution segment, which accounts for 97% of the total order book. EBITDA increased 66% to Rs 200 crore, though margins declined 100 basis points to 12%. The company secured fresh orders worth Rs 1,748 crore in the quarter, up 72% year-on-year. The unexecuted order book stood at Rs 14,654 crore, up 44% year-on-year, while the total order book reached Rs 15,637 crore. Management expects continued demand supported by India's renewable energy capacity target of 500 GW by 2030. The stock is now trading 76% above its IPO price of Rs 432.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports Strong Q1 Revenue Growth Despite Margin Decline
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting reported Q1 consolidated net profit of 1.06 billion rupees, up from 517 million rupees in the previous year. Revenue increased significantly to 16.37 billion rupees from 8.97 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA rose to 1.98 billion rupees compared to 1.2 billion rupees in the prior year period. However, EBITDA margin declined to 12.15% from 13.34% year-over-year.

News.Title: TransRail Lighting Approves Quarterly Results and Makes Key Leadership Appointments
News.Summary: TransRail Lighting Limited's Board approved unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, and made several key appointments. Dr. Dharmendra Singh Gangwar, a retired Indian Administrative Service Officer with 36 years of experience, was appointed as Additional Independent Director for three years. Mr. Randeep Narang was re-appointed as Managing Director & CEO for one year effective December 15, 2025. The company also appointed Mr. Raman Rajagopalan as Additional Whole-Time Director designated as Deputy Managing Director, and Mr. Dhulipala Suryanarayana as Additional Whole-time Director, both for three-year terms. Additionally, Ms. Sonal Raj was appointed as Chief Human Resource Officer. All director appointments are subject to shareholder approval at the upcoming Annual General Meeting.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Schedules Board Meeting on August 5 to Approve Quarterly Financial Results
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited has scheduled a Board of Directors meeting for August 5, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited financial results (standalone and consolidated) for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company has confirmed that the trading window for directors and designated persons, which closed on July 1, 2025, will remain closed until August 7, 2025. The announcement was made by Company Secretary and Compliance Officer Monica Gandhi on July 29, 2025.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting: Stock Surges 58% on Strong Growth and Order Book
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting's stock has risen 58% in 3 months, with 36% growth since Q4 results. The company expects 23-25% revenue growth for FY26, maintaining a 12% EBITDA margin. It has an order book of ₹14,550 crore and added ₹1,600 crore in new contracts in FY26. The company is expanding capacity with a ₹326 crore investment, to be completed by December 2025.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures New Orders Worth ₹534 Crore
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has received fresh orders valued at ₹534 crore. The company's order intake has now exceeded ₹1,600 crore, primarily driven by its core Transmission and Distribution (T&D) segment.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting: Secures Orders Worth ₹534 Crore, Boosts FY26 Order Book
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Ltd. has secured new domestic and international orders worth ₹534 crore, including its largest substation project in Africa. The company's order intake for FY26 has already exceeded ₹1,600 crore. CEO Randeep Narang sees this as a steady build-up in order inflows, primarily in the transmission and distribution segment.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports Q4 Financial Results
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has released its Q4 financial results. The company's EBITDA increased to 2.34 billion rupees from 1.81 billion rupees year-over-year. However, the EBITDA margin decreased to 12.27% from 13.17% compared to the same period last year. Revenue grew to 19.1 billion rupees from 13.73 billion rupees year-over-year. The company's net profit for Q4 rose to 1.25 billion rupees, up from 1.12 billion rupees year-over-year and 975.7 million rupees quarter-over-quarter.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures 10.85 Billion Rupees in Domestic Orders
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has announced that it has secured orders worth 10.85 billion rupees in the domestic market. This significant order book suggests a strong demand for the company's lighting products and services within India.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures 10.85 Billion Rupees in Domestic Orders
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has announced that it has secured orders worth 10.85 billion rupees in the domestic market. This significant order book is likely to boost the company's revenue and market position in the lighting industry.

News.Title: TransRail Lighting Secures New Rs. 240 Crore Transmission & Distribution Order
News.Summary: TransRail Lighting has won a new order in the Transmission & Distribution (T&D) sector valued at Rs. 240 crore. This order represents a significant business opportunity for the company in the power infrastructure segment.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Ltd.: Targets 28-30% Revenue Growth in FY25
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Ltd. expects 28-30% revenue growth in FY25, maintaining 12-12.5% profitability. The company plans Rs 327 crore capex over two years, including a new tower factory. Recent orders worth Rs 4,400 crore were secured, with a 55% domestic and 45% international order book mix.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Projects 28-30% Revenue Growth for FY25
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting Limited has announced its expectation of 28-30% revenue growth for the fiscal year 2025, as reported by NDTV Profit. This projection indicates a strong positive outlook for the company's financial performance in the coming year.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports 95% of New Orders in T&D Business
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has announced that 95% of its new orders are coming from its Transmission and Distribution (T&D) business segment, as reported by NDTV Profit. This indicates a strong focus and growth in the company's T&D operations.

News.Title: TransRail Lighting Secures Orders Worth 4000 Crore in Q4
News.Summary: TransRail Lighting has reported receiving orders valued at 4000 crore rupees during the fourth quarter, as reported by NDTV Profit. This significant order inflow suggests a strong performance for the company in the final quarter of the fiscal year.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting: Secures Orders Worth Rs 1,647 Crore in T&D and Railway Sectors
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has bagged new orders worth Rs 1,647 crore in power transmission and distribution, and railway sectors. The orders include international T&D projects for EPC of transmission lines and substations. Year-to-date order inflows are approaching Rs 9,200 crore.

News.Title: TransRail Lighting Secures Major Order Worth 16.47 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: TransRail Lighting has announced winning a significant order valued at 16.47 billion rupees. This substantial contract represents a major business opportunity for the company and is likely to have a positive impact on its financial performance.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures New Orders Worth ₹2,752 Crore
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has won new orders valued at ₹2,752 crore, significantly strengthening its position in the Transmission & Distribution sector. This development indicates a positive growth trajectory for the company in its core business area.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Secures New Orders Worth ₹2,752 Crore
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has won new orders valued at ₹2,752 crore, significantly strengthening its position in the Transmission & Distribution sector. This development indicates a substantial increase in the company's order book and potential for future growth in the industry.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports Strong Q3 FY2024 Results
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has reported significant year-over-year growth in its Q3 FY2024 financial results. The company's net profit increased to 976 million rupees, up from 458 million rupees in the same quarter last year. Revenue also saw a substantial rise to 13.4 billion rupees, compared to 8.2 billion rupees in the previous year. The company's order intake for the first nine months of FY2024 reached 4,715 crore rupees, with a total order book of 11,499 crore rupees.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports Strong Order Book and Intake
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has announced that its order intake for the nine months ended December 31, 2024, reached Rs. 4,715 crore. Additionally, the company's total order book stood at Rs. 11,499 crore, indicating a robust business pipeline.

News.Title: TransRail Lighting Reports Significant Growth in Q3 EBITDA
News.Summary: TransRail Lighting has announced its Q3 financial results, showing substantial year-over-year improvement. The company's EBITDA increased to 1.84 billion rupees, up from 980 million rupees in the same quarter last year. Additionally, the EBITDA margin improved to 13.73% from 11.91% year-over-year.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports Significant Profit and Revenue Growth in Q3
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has announced its Q3 financial results, showing substantial year-over-year and quarter-over-quarter growth. The company's net profit reached 976 million rupees, up from 458 million rupees in the same quarter last year and 577 million rupees in the previous quarter. Revenue also saw a significant increase, rising to 13.4 billion rupees from 8.2 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Reports Q2 Profit Growth and Approves Capex Plan
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting announced its Q2 results with a net profit of 577 million rupees, up from 475 million rupees year-over-year. Revenue increased to 10.68 billion rupees from 9.6 billion rupees. The company approved a capital expenditure plan of 3.27 billion rupees and plans to raise up to 2.37 billion rupees through debt to fund this capex. The company's total order book stands at 103.58 billion rupees.

News.Title: Transrail Lighting Approves Capex Plan and Debt Funding
News.Summary: Transrail Lighting has approved a capital expenditure (capex) plan of 3.27 billion rupees. To fund this capex, the company has also approved raising up to 2.37 billion rupees through debt. Additionally, the company reports a substantial total order book of 103.58 billion rupees.
